definition: to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
to install/to place/to put/to buy
to seem/like/as/if
to deceive/there is none/old variant of 網|网[wang3]
old variant of 罔[wang3]
to hear/news/well-known/famous/reputation/fame/to smell/to sniff at
surname Wen

sentences.english: But these warnings were ignored, and the crisis came.
sentences.chinese: 这些警告被置若罔闻，结果危机来了。

sentences.english: She also ignored his call as she pushed through the double glass doors.
sentences.chinese: 她匆匆穿过双扇玻璃门，对身后的呼唤也置若罔闻。

sentences.english: Is the cello listening to the answer, or is it oblivious?
sentences.chinese: 大提琴是否接受了这个回答，还是对其置若罔闻？

sentences.english: The government even turned a deaf ear to the direct intervention by the ILO.
sentences.chinese: 同时，国民政府对国际劳工局的直接干预也置若罔闻。

sentences.english: " said Mrs. Jennings, without attending to her daughter's reproof .
sentences.chinese: 詹宁斯太太说，对女儿的责备置若罔闻。

sentences.english: You cannot ignore them once truly heard.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你真的听到，就不能置若罔闻。

sentences.english: He turns a deaf ear to what the boss says, never taking it seriously.
sentences.chinese: 他对老板的话置若罔闻，根原不把它当回事。

sentences.english: This isn't easy for most people to accept, which is why they might dismiss an article like this.
sentences.chinese: 当然多数人对此置若罔闻，因为这的确易说难行。

definition: to block one's ears and not listen (idiom); to turn a deaf ear
to turn a blind eye to
to pay no heed to (idiom)/to ignore/to brush aside
to hear but not react (idiom); to turn a deaf ear/to ignore deliberately
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
aloof/indifferent/unconcerned
to remain unmoved
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
to pay no attention to a familiar sight/to ignore
to completely ignore (idiom)/to pay no attention to/not to be in the least concerned about
to play deaf-mute
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
to take a laissez-faire attitude
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
to heed/to pay attention to
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
